titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Fales Library Poster Collection MSS.586
titlestmt.author: Stacey Flatt

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-05 11:32:45 -0500.

did.abstract: This collection was assembled by Special Collections staff from individual posters donated to the libary. Posters in this collection include artwork and promotions for publications, exhibitions, and educational programs, many of which focus on art, music, film, and theater in New York City. Materials date from 1968 to 2010.
did.langmaterial: Materials are mostly in English and a few in German.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials gifted from various donors, 2017-2019. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.049.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are listed in the order in which they were received from the donors.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Fales Poster Collection; MSS 586; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were unrolled and placed in a new acid-free flat-file folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection was assembled by Special Collections staff from individual posters donated to the library. Posters in this collection include artwork as well as promotions for publications, exhibitions, and educational programs, many of which focus on art, music, film, and theater in New York City. Materials date from 1968 to 2010.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

controlaccess.subject: Graphic art.
controlaccess.corpname: School of Visual Arts (New York, N.Y.)

Black Gale 1968 Publication Promotion. Later signed by Aldo Tambellini
